Title: UTOPIA 2016: A Year of Imagination and Possibility Press Release Somerset House
Student Note: 2016 marks the 500th anniversary of the publication of Thomas More's 'Utopia'. There are many activities taking place around London: Utopias is the topic of the LSE Literary Festival (22-27 Feb.); the first edition of More's Utopia is on display at the British Library; many  activities at Sommerset House; and activist art projects in less official spaces. Students could combine activities by these people with interviews with theorists. There is a possibility that the film could be shown at the Utopia Fair in June 24-26 at Sommerset House.

Title: Further Considerations Concerning Raising the Value of Money - 1695
Author: Locke, John
Student Note: Do not be perturbed if you find this reading to be difficult. The writing is unfamiliar and bad. The specific debate--about 'raising the coin'--is esoteric...........But the broader debate is something with which you are all rather familiar: exchange rate regimes. The question here is whether the state can and should have a permanently fixed exchange rate or whether it should have the discretion to adjust the exchange rate peg. As you read, keep that debate at the forefront of your minds...........Here's a hint for those of you (particularly in IR450) who remember this debate in Bretton Woods: John Locke is to Harry Dexter White as William Lowdnes is to JM Keynes (kind of!)...........Just read the following...........Start reading at this sentence: 'SILVER is the Instrument and Measure of Commerce in all the Civilized and Trading parts of the World.'..........Stop reading at this sentence: 'The Exchange is High, when a Man pays for Bills of Exchange above the Par. It is Low when he pays less than the Par.'
